ReactorEE.pcomponents

Class Pump

  • java.lang.Object
    • ReactorEE.pcomponents.PlantComponent
      • ReactorEE.pcomponents.Pump
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class Pump
extends PlantComponent
    Pump is a plant component that pumps some amount of water based on pump's "on" state and its RPM. There is a chance that a pump fails randomly.
    Author:
    Lamprey
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • getID

        public int getID()
        Returns:
        the ID of this pump.

      • getRpm

        public int getRpm()
        Note: If the pump is off, the RPM returned will be zero. If the pump is broken, the RPM returned will also be zero.
        Returns:
        the current RPM value of the pump

      • setRpm

        public void setRpm(int rpm)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Sets a new value for the RPM of the pump
        Parameters:
        rpm - the new value
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • isOn

        public boolean isOn()
        Returns:
        true if the pump is on

      • setOn

        public void setOn(boolean on)
        Sets the pump (on/off).
        Parameters:
        on - true if the pump needs to be on, false if it needs to be off

      • getMaxRpm

        public int getMaxRpm()
        Returns:
        the max RPM of the pump.

      • updateState

        public void updateState()
        Update the state of the pump. Increases the failure rate of the pump if appropriate.
        Specified by:
        updateState in class PlantComponent

      • checkFailure

        Checks if the pump fails randomly.
        Overrides:

        Returns:
